lines.content: AI model used: ChatGPT o4 / o1 model
Everything else: Mostly entirely generated by AI
Probably saved 1h of time per increment
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named **ATRI**, and is a chatbot with task management functionality. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
**Prerequisites:** JDK 17, update IntelliJ to the most recent version.
2. Type in the required commands, or help to get a list of commands
ATRI is designed to interact with users in a way that feels truly human, with curiosity, warmth, and a touch of wistful charm. This chatbot offers engaging conversation and deep companionship.
- Code + Documentation: Mostly generated by AI
- Setup scripts such as build.gradle, gradle.yml: Course website

ATRI is a high-performance chatbot designed to assist users with task management in a structured and intuitive manner. With ATRI, you can effortlessly track, manage, and organize your tasks, ensuring efficiency and clarity in your daily activities.
ATRI allows you to add different types of tasks:
Task registered! I've added this one:
Now you have X tasks in the list. Exciting!
Understood! I've marked this task as done for you:
Got it! I've removed this task:
Now you have X tasks left. Let's keep going!
Ooh! I found some tasks that match what you're looking for:
Did I do a good job? Let's keep improving together!
Hello! I'm Atri, your high-performance assistant!
I love learning and helping you keep track of everything.
Here's how you can use me:
• mark <n>   : Mark task number n as done.
• unmark <n> : Mark task number n as not done yet.
• find <keyword> : Find tasks containing a keyword.
If you ever need help, just ask! Let's do our best together!
Bye-bye! I hope to see you again soon. Take care, okay?
Enjoy using **ATRI** for managing your tasks efficiently!

* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Atri's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Parses user commands and date/time strings.
* This class provides utility methods for parsing user input into commands and for converting date/time strings
* Parses the user command into command and arguments.
* Splits the input line by space to separate the command keyword from the arguments.
* @param inputLine The full input line from the user.
* @return An array of strings, where the first element is the command \
*          and the second element is the arguments (can be null if no arguments).
assert parts.length > 0 : "parseCommand should always return at least one element (the command)";
* Parses a date and time string into a LocalDateTime object.
* Uses the format "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" to parse the date and time string.
* Returns null if parsing fails due to invalid format.
* @param dateTimeString The date and time string to parse.
* @return LocalDateTime object if parsing is successful, null otherwise.
* Parses the arguments for a deadline command.
* Splits the arguments string by " /by " to separate the description from the deadline time string.
* @param arguments The arguments string for the deadline command.
* @return An array of strings, where the first element is the description and the second \
*          element is the deadline time string.
assert parts.length == 2 : "parseDeadlineArguments should return exactly two parts (description and deadline)";
* Parses the arguments for an event command.
* Splits the arguments string by " /from " and " /to " to separate the description, \
*          from time string, and to time string.
* @param arguments The arguments string for the event command.
* @return An array of strings, where the first element is the description, \
*          the second is the from time string, and the third is the to time string.
assert parts.length == 3 : "parseEventArguments should return exactly three parts (description, from, and to)";
* Loading and saving tasks to a persistent data file.  Refactored for better

* @return An ArrayList of Task objects loaded from the file.
List<Task> tasks = lines.map(taskParser::parseTaskLine) // Use the injected parser

return new ArrayList<>(); // Return empty list on error

* This is the base class for different types of tasks in the Duke application.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Sets the isDone status to true.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Sets the isDone status to false.
* Returns the type of the task.
* This is an abstract method to be implemented by subclasses.
* @return A string representing the task type.
* Returns a string representation of the task for display.
* Includes the task type, status, and description.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task for file storage.
* @return A formatted string for saving the task to a file.
* @param description The description of the To Do task.
* Returns the task type for To Do tasks.
* For To Do tasks, the type is "T".
* A Deadline task has a specific deadline by which it needs to be completed.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by          The LocalDateTime representing the deadline.
* Returns the task type for Deadline tasks.
* For Deadline tasks, the type is "D".
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task for display.
* Includes the task details and the deadline.
* @return A formatted string representing the Deadline task.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HHmm");
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task for file storage.
* Includes the base file string and the deadline formatted for file storage.
* @return A formatted string for saving the Deadline task to a file.
* An Event task has a start and end time.
* @param description The description of the Event task.
* @param from        The LocalDateTime representing the start time of the event.
* @param to          The LocalDateTime representing the end time of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Returns the task type for Event tasks.
* For Event tasks, the type is "E".

* @return A formatted string representing the Event task.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HHmm");

return "Great! I've marked this task as complete:\n  " + task;

return "Noted. I've removed this task:\n  " + task
+ "\nNow there are " + remainingTasks + (remainingTasks == 1 ? " task" : " tasks") + " remaining.";

* Returns a string representation of a task list item.

return "Here are the tasks in your list:";

* Returns an error message for invalid date input.

return "Goodbye! Looking forward to our next productive session.";

I'm here to help you manage your tasks with efficiency and care.
Here's how we can work together:
• mark <n>   : Mark task number n as done.
• unmark <n> : Mark task number n as not done.
Need a reminder? Just type 'help' anytime.
